about.description:
Pysolar is a collection of Python libraries for simulating the irradiation of any point on earth by the sun.
It includes code for extremely precise ephemeris calculations, and more.
about.summary: A collection of Python libraries for simulating the irradiation of any point on earth by the sun

about.description:
Pysolar is a collection of Python libraries for simulating the irradiation of any point on earth by the sun.
It includes code for extremely precise ephemeris calculations, and more.
about.summary: A collection of Python libraries for simulating the irradiation of any point on earth by the sun

name: pysolar
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.10" %}

package:
  name: pysolar
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/pingswept/pysolar/archive/{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: afc96deb6844192a70e4bb207ace117e47b0ef1cecd7aaabcd72642c19f547b5

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps --ignore-installed -vvv

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python >=3.5
  run:
    - python >=3.5
    - numpy
    - pytz

test:
  imports:
    - pysolar

about:
  home: http://pysolar.org/
  license: GPL-3.0
  license_file: COPYING
  license_family: GPL
  summary: A collection of Python libraries for simulating the irradiation of any point on earth by the sun
  description: |
    Pysolar is a collection of Python libraries for simulating the irradiation of any point on earth by the sun.
    It includes code for extremely precise ephemeris calculations, and more.
  doc_url: http://docs.pysolar.org/en/latest/
  dev_url: https://github.com/pingswept/pysolar

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - robintw
